verses.kjv: And God said unto Jacob, Arise, go up to Bethel, and dwell there: and make there an altar unto God, that appeared unto thee when thou fleddest from the face of Esau thy brother.
verses.ct: God said to Jacob, "Get up and go to Bethel. Settle there and build an altar to God, who appeared to you when you were running away from your brother Esau."

verses.kjv: Then Jacob said unto his household, and to all that were with him, Put away the strange gods that are among you, and be clean, and change your garments:
verses.ct: So Jacob told his household and everyone with him, "Get rid of the foreign gods you have among you. Purify yourselves and put on fresh clothing."

verses.kjv: And let us arise, and go up to Bethel; and I will make there an altar unto God, who answered me in the day of my distress, and was with me in the way which I went.
verses.ct: "Then we'll go up to Bethel, where I will build an altar to God — the one who responded to me during my time of trouble and who stayed with me throughout my journey."

verses.kjv: And they gave unto Jacob all the strange gods which were in their hand, and all their earrings which were in their ears; and Jacob hid them under the oak which was by Shechem.
verses.ct: They handed over to Jacob all the foreign gods they had, along with the earrings they were wearing. Jacob buried them under the oak tree near Shechem.

verses.kjv: And they journeyed: and the terror of God was upon the cities that were round about them, and they did not pursue after the sons of Jacob.
verses.ct: As they set out, God struck such terror into the surrounding towns that no one dared to come after Jacob's sons.

verses.kjv: So Jacob came to Luz, which is in the land of Canaan, that is, Bethel, he and all the people that were with him.
verses.ct: Jacob and everyone with him arrived at Luz (which is Bethel) in the land of Canaan.

verses.kjv: And he built there an altar, and called the place Elbethel: because there God appeared unto him, when he fled from the face of his brother.
verses.ct: He built an altar there and named the place El-bethel, because that was where God had revealed himself to him when he was fleeing from his brother.

verses.kjv: But Deborah Rebekah’s nurse died, and she was buried beneath Bethel under an oak: and the name of it was called Allonbachuth.
verses.ct: Deborah, Rebekah's nurse, died and was buried beneath Bethel under an oak tree. They named that place Allon-bachuth.

verses.kjv: And God appeared unto Jacob again, when he came out of Padanaram, and blessed him.
verses.ct: God appeared to Jacob again after he had returned from Paddan-aram and blessed him.

verses.kjv: And God said unto him, Thy name is Jacob: thy name shall not be called any more Jacob, but Israel shall be thy name: and he called his name Israel.
verses.ct: God told him, "Your name is Jacob, but you will no longer be called Jacob. From now on your name will be Israel." So God named him Israel.

verses.kjv: And God said unto him, I am God Almighty: be fruitful and multiply; a nation and a company of nations shall be of thee, and kings shall come out of thy loins;
verses.ct: God also told him, "I am God Almighty. Be fruitful and multiply. A nation — even a collection of nations — will descend from you, and kings will come from your line."

verses.kjv: And the land which I gave Abraham and Isaac, to thee I will give it, and to thy seed after thee will I give the land.
verses.ct: "The land I gave to Abraham and Isaac, I am giving to you, and I will give it to your descendants after you."

verses.kjv: And God went up from him in the place where he talked with him.
verses.ct: Then God rose up from him at the place where he had spoken with him.

verses.kjv: And Jacob set up a pillar in the place where he talked with him, even a pillar of stone: and he poured a drink offering thereon, and he poured oil thereon.
verses.ct: Jacob set up a stone pillar at the spot where God had spoken with him. He poured out a drink offering on it and also poured oil over it.

verses.kjv: And Jacob called the name of the place where God spake with him, Bethel.
verses.ct: Jacob named the place where God had spoken with him Bethel.

verses.kjv: And they journeyed from Bethel; and there was but a little way to come to Ephrath: and Rachel travailed, and she had hard labour.
verses.ct: They moved on from Bethel, and while they were still some distance from Ephrath, Rachel went into labor, and her delivery was extremely difficult.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when she was in hard labour, that the midwife said unto her, Fear not; thou shalt have this son also.
verses.ct: During the worst of her labor, the midwife told her, "Don't be afraid — you're having another son."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as her soul was in departing, (for she died) that she called his name Benoni: but his father called him Benjamin.
verses.ct: As she was dying — with her last breath slipping away — she named him Ben-oni. But his father called him Benjamin.

verses.kjv: And Rachel died, and was buried in the way to Ephrath, which is Bethlehem.
verses.ct: Rachel died and was buried along the road to Ephrath, which is Bethlehem.

verses.kjv: And Jacob set a pillar upon her grave: that is the pillar of Rachel’s grave unto this day.
verses.ct: Jacob set up a pillar over her grave, and it marks Rachel's burial site to this day.

verses.kjv: And Israel journeyed, and spread his tent beyond the tower of Edar.
verses.ct: Israel continued his journey and set up camp past the tower of Eder.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Israel dwelt in that land, that Reuben went and lay with Bilhah his father’s concubine: and Israel heard it. Now the sons of Jacob were twelve:
verses.ct: While Israel was living in that region, Reuben slept with Bilhah, his father's secondary wife, and Israel found out about it. Jacob had 12 sons:

verses.kjv: The sons of Leah; Reuben, Jacob’s firstborn, and Simeon, and Levi, and Judah, and Issachar, and Zebulun:
verses.ct: Leah's sons were Reuben (Jacob's firstborn), Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, and Zebulun.

verses.kjv: The sons of Rachel; Joseph, and Benjamin:
verses.ct: Rachel's sons were Joseph and Benjamin.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Bilhah, Rachel’s handmaid; Dan, and Naphtali:
verses.ct: The sons of Bilhah, Rachel's servant, were Dan and Naphtali.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Zilpah, Leah’s handmaid; Gad, and Asher: these are the sons of Jacob, which were born to him in Padanaram.
verses.ct: The sons of Zilpah, Leah's servant, were Gad and Asher. These were Jacob's sons, born to him in Paddan-aram.

verses.kjv: And Jacob came unto Isaac his father unto Mamre, unto the city of Arbah, which is Hebron, where Abraham and Isaac sojourned.
verses.ct: Jacob made his way to his father Isaac at Mamre, near Kiriath-arba (which is Hebron), where Abraham and Isaac had lived.

verses.kjv: And the days of Isaac were an hundred and fourscore years.
verses.ct: Isaac lived to be 180 years old.

verses.kjv: And Isaac gave up the ghost, and died, and was gathered unto his people, being old and full of days: and his sons Esau and Jacob buried him.
verses.ct: Then Isaac took his last breath and died, joining his ancestors at a ripe old age after a full life. His sons Esau and Jacob buried him.
